EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:

The Triumph Foods facility located in Saint Joseph, Missouri, is a pork slaughter/processing plant which will employ approximatley 2200 area employees when operating two full shifts, plus a maintenance/cleaning crew on third shift.  The 630,000 sq ft plant is on a 59 acre plot in the stockyards industrial complex which is refrigerated with a 120,000 pound anhydrous ammonia system.  This state of the art system is operated 24/7 by experienced, licensed refrigeration management and operators. 

Over one half of the plant is protected by an automatic sprinkler system where flammables and combusible materials are either used or stored.  The balance of the facility is of concrete and metal construction.  The sprinkler system is monitored by a remote alarm system which is supervised by security personnel which are on site 24/7.  

The plant has a Waste Water Pre-Treatment Plant on site to ensure all waste water is within St. Joseph Waste Water Permit specifications before being released to the city waste water system.  Storm water runoff is managed by the use of detention ponds on the site. 

All employees are trained per OSHA, EPA regulations and other mandated industrial standards, including Hazards Communications which instructs employees on the particular hazards and proper handling of the cleaning and sanitizing chemicals used in the plant.  Particular emphasis is placed on the reporting of spills and releases or any other unusual events.

Triumph Foods has written emergency action and response plans which identify potential emergencies and the steps to be taken to safetly remove all employees from harms way in the event incidents should arise.  A Health Services Department is staffed by nurses on both production shifts and supplemented with designated First Aid/CPR/AED responders throughout all departments and shifts to provide medical for employees.

Emergency declaration is done via radio and/or telephone to designated Emergency Coordinators, w

ho will then direct activation of the plant alarm system which utilizes a combinations strobes/ chimes/ air horns to alert employees of the type of hazards. 

The plant has a Plant Emergency Response Team of approximately 30 maintenance employees for response to any chemical spills or releases beyond the normal scope of work.   Plant Emergency Response Team members receive additional training for; Incident Command, 24 Hr HAZWOPER Technician, Confined Space Rescue, High Angle Rescue, and First Aid/CPR/AED. 

Triumph Foods does not have a Fire Brigade on site, but the Saint Joseph Fire Department's Station #2 is within one-half mile from the plant, and Station #1 is within three miles.

The plants Emergency Action and Response Plans are shared with the Saint Joseph Fire Department, Northwest Missouri Region H Hazardous Materials Response Team, and the St. Joseph/ Buchanan Co. Local Emergency Planning Committee.  Triumph Foods will host any emergency response agency wishing to tour the facility and will schedule joint response drills periodically.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

As this is a new facility, there are not NH3 related injuries to report.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Continued training as listed above, plus cooperative efforts with local and regional ERS.
